me.zingle.api.sdk.services

Class ZingleMessageServices

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.zingle.api.sdk.services.ZingleBaseService<me.zingle.api.sdk.model.ZingleMessage>
      • me.zingle.api.sdk.services.ZingleMessageServices

  • public class ZingleMessageServices
extends ZingleBaseService<me.zingle.api.sdk.model.ZingleMessage>
    ZingleBaseService derivation for working with ZingleMessage API except create. For sending messages see ZingleNewMessageService Supports all getting by id and listing. Updating reduced to marking as read and wrapped in separate function.

      • markRead

        public me.zingle.api.sdk.model.ZingleMessage markRead(me.zingle.api.sdk.model.ZingleMessage msg)
        Sends request to mark message as read (put read_at timestamp).
        Parameters:
        msg - - message to mark read. Must specify id.
        Returns:
        updated ZingleMessage object

      • markReadAsync

        public boolean markReadAsync(me.zingle.api.sdk.model.ZingleMessage message)
        Same as boolean markReadAsync(ZingleMessage message,ServiceDelegate delegate), but implementation of ServiceDelegate is taken from markReadDelegate property.
        Parameters:
        message - - message to mark read. Must specify id.
        Returns:
        true if request starts successfully

      • markReadAsync

        public boolean markReadAsync(me.zingle.api.sdk.model.ZingleMessage message,
                    ServiceDelegate<me.zingle.api.sdk.model.ZingleMessage> delegate)
        Same as ZingleMessage markRead(ZingleMessage msg), but runs request in separate thread. Result is received by proper implementation of ServiceDelegate, provided as function parameter.
        Parameters:
        message - - message to mark read. Must specify id.
        delegate - - implementation of ServiceDelegate
        Returns:
        true if request starts successfully

      • setMarkReadDelegate

        public void setMarkReadDelegate(ServiceDelegate<me.zingle.api.sdk.model.ZingleMessage> markReadDelegate)
